description.raw:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=building_editor&branch=building_editor

Not sure if there's an easy way to visualize the images ([apparently there isn't](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-request/92/gazebojs-nodejs-bindings-for-gazebo/activity#comment-3254893)).

So I'm doing as follows on Firefox (I'm sure it must be possible on other browsers too). It might break some stuff on the page but the tutorial renders fine.

1. Open the link above and hit `Ctrl+Shift+I` to open the page inspector

2. On the inspector, right-click the HTML tag and choose `Edit as HTML`, the text becomes editable

3. `Ctrl+A` to select the whole text, `Ctrl+C` to copy it

4. Open a text editor such as gedit and paste the text

5. Replace all `default/building_editor` with `building_editor/building_editor` using the search and replace tool

6. Select all, copy all and paste it on the inspector back on Firefox. 

7. Be sure to leave the HTML edit mode by clicking outside it, for example, clicking on the `<!DOCTYPE html>` tag.

8. The page should reload
description.html:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=building_editor&branch=building_editor

Not sure if there's an easy way to visualize the images (apparently there isn't).

So I'm doing as follows on Firefox (I'm sure it must be possible on other browsers too). It might break some stuff on the page but the tutorial renders fine.

  1. Open the link above and hit Ctrl+Shift+I to open the page inspector

  2. On the inspector, right-click the HTML tag and choose Edit as HTML, the text becomes editable

  3. Ctrl+A to select the whole text, Ctrl+C to copy it

  4. Open a text editor such as gedit and paste the text

  5. Replace all default/building_editor with building_editor/building_editor using the search and replace tool

  6. Select all, copy all and paste it on the inspector back on Firefox.

  7. Be sure to leave the HTML edit mode by clicking outside it, for example, clicking on the <!DOCTYPE html> tag.

  8. The page should reload
